data.title: Wonderful B & B
data.text: If you're traveling to Columbus, Georgia, this is a great place to spend the night. Mamie Pound offers wonderful hospitality, and you'll love breakfast. Historic home, great local artifacts. Central location, easy walk to Broadway and the river. You'll enjoy your experience.

data.title: Comfortable Bed and Breakfast; lovely owners
data.text: We stayed at this bed and breakfast for one night only.  Gaye, the owner, greeted us on arrival and was very welcoming.  She told us that she and her family used to own more B&Bs in the area as well as a restaurant but have since sold a few of them as well as the restaurant.  They do well with decor and comfort.  Our room was on the ground floor and had a king size bed and a large bathroom.  Wifi is free and Gaye puts out snacks and lemonade in the evenings.  The breakfast we had was very good, and we enjoyed talking to Maime, Gaye's daughter.  She and her husband, an artist who painted much of the artwork in the B&B, prepared and served the breakfast.  Maime gave us tips for future festivals, etc., in the city, so we hope to return.

data.title: Unique Place to Stay
data.text: Went here for my anniversary. We are from the Fort Benning area and just wanted a quick get away for the night on our anniversary. I was looking for something more memorable than a hotel. This was the place. It has lots of cool art and there is a ton of interesting things to see and a fascinating history. The room was nice and the staff was amazing. They had some doughnuts brownies and lemonade out and breakfast was great.

data.title: Bed and breakfast
data.text: Quaint B and B w very good breakfast and comfortable room. Owners extremely friendly and accommodating. Located close to highway and only 30 minutes from auburn. We were there for the football game and easy in and out

data.title: Souther Charm
data.text:
This place is probably one of the best representations of southern charm!!!
A Victorian bed-and-breakfast in a house built in the 1870's that is exquisitely preserved, filled southern charm, character and elegance.
The hosts are friendly and very accommodating, they make you feel at home.
Perfectly located near Columbus-old downtown, a beautiful lively and laid back city center filled with restaurants and shops... Good food and music.
Most likely one of the best places to stay in Columbus Georgia.

data.title: Sadly disappointing!
data.text:
I am always reluctant to give less than a great review but my husband and I were really disappointed in this B&B.  We have traveled the world and often stay in B&B properties so I feel we have some experience and perspective. There were good points:  very well located near all the action in Columbus; nice breakfast; well appointed period furnishings.  The bad points:  
1.  Although the room description states that there is wine and cheese served from 5:30-7:30 nightly, the night we were there they "decided not to do it."  No excuse given.  
2.  We stayed in the Rothschild Suite which is located on the ground floor right next to the front door--we heard the magnified conversations of every guest who arrived--even late into the night.
3.  The room was VERY warm until it finally cooled down by about 3am--a box fan may have helped with both the noise level and the heat. Thermostat was located outside of the room but was set as low as it would go.
4.  The next morning there was NO hot water both times I tried to take a shower.
5.  Finally, I have emailed the manager repeatedly to have my paid bill emailed to me--the manager was unavailable when we left.  I still have not gotten it....
I'm not sure if a manager actually living on site would help and perhaps this was a perfect storm of problems and this was very unusual for this property but the lack of attention to details was most disappointing.  Cannot recommend.

owner_response.author: rothschildpoundhouse, Owner at Rothschild - Pound House Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your feedback. I am so sorry that you were disappointed in any way. We want every guest to leave our inn feeling like they've discovered a gem, in the way of hospitality, service, and accommodations. I really wish you would've let one of our staff know you were having trouble. We are available 24 hours a day. And we do have a manager on the property at all times. It sounds like it could be operator error since we've had hundreds before you and at least a dozen after you without complaint. There is a  brand new air conditioner and water heater, dedicated to that room. I apologize for the loud guests. We had a family here with a son arriving home from Afghanistan and I bet that's what you heard. Those can be quite emotional and exciting reunions. But, no matter what, we should've closed the parlor next to your suite so you'd have complete quiet. And from now on we will. We no longer offer wine and cheese. Instead, we do afternoon desserts, coffee, etc.., as was pointed out to you the evening you were here. Guests may bring their own wine. If you check your confirmation, you will see that noted. Thank you for the opportunity to host you. I hope you will try The Rothschild-Pound House Inn again, next time you're in town.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delightful stay (as always)
data.text: We have had the pleasure of staying at this charming Inn three times. Each time was delightful and this last visit didn't disappoint. We arrived and were greeted by Gaye who made us feel right at home. We were checked into the J W Springer cottage and we quickly decided that this particular accommodation was our new favorite. The lovely tree-shaded front porch with two cushioned rocking chairs was perfect for relaxing with a glass of wine after our two-hour drive. We stepped through the front door (with its colorful glass pane) into the parlor, beautifully decorated with eclectic artworks, books, magazines, and a working fireplace. We were super happy, though, when we walked past the parlor to find the stunning bedroom with its large (super comfy) canopied bed. The super large bathroom featured a huge shower with a rainfall shower head, separate jacuzzi bath, and pedestal sink. The Springer cottage also has a full kitchen complete with dinnerware, flatware, coffee mugs & wine glasses, microwave, coffee maker, full-size refrigerator and small dining table for two. We walked out the back door to find a full gazebo, as well. During our two night/three day visit, we encountered one of the Housekeepers who wanted to make sure we had everything we needed and was quick to offer extra coffee as requested. We saw Gaye again as we relaxed on our porch rockers on the porch and she walked over to make sure we were happy with everything. Yes, we certainly were. We'll definitely be back, yet again.

data.title: Travel back in time
data.text:
I often book our lodgings online and rely heavily upon past reviews and comments from previous travelers, however in writing this particular review, I'm not quite sure I can capture the the essence of this wonderful bed and breakfast in my limited vocabulary. From the moment I spoke to Ms. Gay on the phone and heard her warm
voice I knew this was going to be a pleasant stay. What I did not realize is that at the end of my visit, I may not want to leave and go home. The Rothschild-pound House Inn has to be one of the most peaceful downtown accommodations I've ever visited. Located in the Historic district of Columbus GA, it's a short walk to the newly revitalized downtown area of Broad St offering many options to quench any appetite or thirst. 
The rooms are decorated in authentic Victorian period with even the creaking floorboards and squeaky doorknobs of old. The character oozes out of the walls and leaves you with the thirsty desire to know more of how things were back then, and who may have sat there on that porch and rocked on the swing listening to the birds and life go by. 
I leave this place with a peaceful mind and heart full of warmth contemplating on how and when I shall return again. 
Thank you Ms.Gay your hospitality was second to none.

data.title: Not impressed....
data.text: To start off, this was the most I have ever spent on a "hotel". It was a big hassle trying to get in contact with them, they never answered their phone so I had to email back and forth. When we got there, we checked in late so I wasn't expecting to see anybody there but the 2 nights we were there the only time I saw them was when they brought breakfast to our room. Whenever we needed them, they were nowhere to be found. We didn't even see them when we were checking out. Also, we were told the morning of our stay that we were in one room, they called back that night and switched our room to the cheapest room, it was nice but not what I wanted. There was also a big gap underneath the door, so if you're wanting to have a romantic getaway don't stay in the main house. All the doors have a big gap.  The only thing that was good about the trip was that the house was beautiful. I was not impressed for the price I paid.

owner_response.author: rothschildpoundhouse, Owner at Rothschild - Pound House Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: You requested the military rate, because you wanted to "save 200.00". I explained to you, in extravagant detail, the difference in your rate. We absolutely did not change your room at the last minute. You did. Our policies are given in detail, online and in person. But we leave the decision up to the customer. You definitely get what you pay for. If this rate was the most you've ever paid for a hotel room, you most likely will remain disappointed. Your accommodations, even at this discounted rate are far and away superior to anything else you will find for that price.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great stay at an historic house
data.text: The house is gorgeous. It's has spots that show its age, but that is part of the charm. I stayed in the Rothschild suite, downstairs. The room was great, and the bed was high and comfortable. The bathroom was pretty much original, and it was large and comfortable. The hosts are really pleasant, and the breakfasts on the porch just perfect.

data.title: Southern Charm !
data.text:
We have been here many times and always love it. Mamie and Garry are perfect hosts to all who visit. The rooms are beautiful. Softest sheets I have ever slept on!  
We can't wait to go back. The inn is located near the river walk and also is very close to many wonderful restaurants. The Springer Opera House is just around the corner. Beautiful tree lined streets and historic homes.

data.title: Pound House Inn
data.text:
Ruthette and I enjoyed our stay here with friendly hosts and workers, clean accommodations and a happy time, the weekend of May 22, 2015. The bedroom was well appointed, as was the rest of the bed and breakfast. We were impressed by the fact that this B&B has been around since 1870. 
Also, the sitting room downstairs was very quaintly decorated and had a baby grand piano which I enjoyed playing since I am a musician. Wine was available in an adjoining room. 
Each morning we awakened to a very tasty breakfast made from scratch. It was very filling and lasted us much of the day. We ate these breakfasts while sitting on their large, beautiful front porch and were well-attended by the Inn's two young ladies who accommodated our every request while there. 
We would recommend a stay at the Rothschild-Pound House Inn in Columbus Georgia to anyone traveling there.
John Evans
Ruthette Crane
Jacksonville Florida

data.title: Perfect for a romantic getaway in a charming town.
data.text: Columbus Georgia would be the perfect town to spend a long weekend in. The Rothschild-Pound House Inn being the perfect location for that. I recently stayed here and loved my suite. The room was huge with a luxurious bed, sitting area, and bathroom. The staff were all kind and the Inn was spotless and maintained beautifully.

data.title: Best Place to Stay in Columbus Georgia
data.text:
This is a very charming B & B in the heart of the historic district in Columbus, Georgia.  We stayed here as our son was at Fort Benning.

We enjoyed our visit and would come back to this facility. It is a charming home dating to the late 19th century that possess a great amount of personality and ambience. I loved the classical music. 

The breakfast was inadequate and the beds tended to be uncomfortable. The home was air-conditioned. We stayed two nights in the Rothchild Room. If one puts these negatives aside you will enjoy your stay.  There is no better facility in this part of Georgia.

The bed in the Pritchard Cottage had a curve in the middle of the mattress unsuitable for sleeping in.

data.title: Perfect place for our anniversary
data.text:
The Historic District of Columbus is a real jewel in the state of Georgia, and this place is the perfect centerpiece. Not only we were welcomed as if we were old friends, but we immediately felt at home. The management has done an outstanding job of fostering a welcoming atmosphere while at the same time maintaining an atmosphere of historic authenticity that makes you feel like you've stepped back in time 100 years (yet with modern conveniences).

Not only will we be back for another visit, but next time we'll stay longer and schedule fewer other events (there are many to choose from in Columbus) so that we can spend more time soaking up the atmosphere and exploring all there is to see within walking and biking distance. The perfect location in Columbus, especially for those who are more interested in local attractions, stores and restaurants instead of the usual-suspect chains on the north side of town.

data.title: a pleasure and delight to stay here
data.text:
Our stay at the Rothschild-Pound B&B in Columbus was a pleasure and a delight. This gracious, stylishly homey Victorian house is well-maintained, beautifully decorated, welcoming and warm.  We found all the basics were well-attended to, our bed was exceptionally comfortable, and there were several nice extra touches: flowers in our room; wine, cheese and crackers in the afternoon; many comfortable, attractive sitting areas. The pleasant innkeepers were accommodating and flexible with good suggestions for places to eat, things to do, and suggestions for getting around. The B&B is conveniently located to take advantage of the many opportunities in downtown Columbus. It was a treat coming down the impressive stairway to a delicious breakfast and excellent coffee as a cheerful fire burned in the sitting room. My only regret was that we couldn't stay longer, but we do plan to return. 
 
Dan and Ellen Corrie

data.title: Our experience
data.text:
On arrival we were welcomed and climbed the flight of stairs to our room in the main house. No one to assist with luggage. The first night we were there we nearly froze as there was no heat. There is not enough hot water to take a bath. Television too snowy to watch
One of the two days we were there saw one owner for a few minutes at breakfast. On a positive note breakfast both mornings was wonderful and they allowed our son to join us which was very nice
Very disappointed in room with the amount charged

owner_response.author: rothschildpoundhouse, Owner at Rothschild - Pound House Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience. I am puzzled by your heat and water issues. The heat control is at the door to your suite in the room in which you stayed. And it's working well. In fact, it's a brand new unit as of this summer. Maybe you weren't given instructions on how to adjust it? There's also a brand new hot water heater. I haven't had this complaint before or since about the water, not to minimize your discomfort at all, but I am very surprised at your feedback. The television, also brand new was on the wrong channel, on the tv itself. All you had to do was just change the channel on the tv to get a clear picture. It's a shame that you didn't ask us while you were here. We certainly would have helped you in any way, moving you to another room if necessary to make you comfortable. Our goal is to welcome the world as strangers, hoping they leave as satisfied and soon-to-return friends. Thanks again for your time.
With Respect,
Mamie Pound
Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Felt like I found the best-kept secret for a great weekend trip
data.text:
I cannot adequately describe just how amazing this place is. My wife and I stay in the the main second level suite in the main house. We were with a group of friends for a weekend trip, and the Rothschild-Pound House Inn was easily the highlight of our trip (and it was a great trip all around!). 
This place will make you want to sell your own home and move right in. The whole time you are there you cannot help but forget about every worry and stress from "the real world." Then, just when you think it can't get any better, you sit down to an excellent breakfast each morning. 
I could have literally spent our entire time in Columbus on the grounds of the inn and had one of the best vacations of my life. This place is more than amazing.

data.title: Loved the rooms and service!
data.text: We stayed here for a weekend getaway with several other couples. The house and cottages were perfect for what we needed. We relaxed at the house and were able to walk into nearby downtown for restaurants and shopping. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was delicious and the wine and cheese in the afternoon was just what we needed before going out for dinner. We can't wait to visit again!

data.title: Great weekend trip
data.text: This was a weekend getaway trip and we stayed in a very cool shotgun cottage. We got great service and enjoyed the unique accommodations in the historic district of Columbus, GA. It was especially fun to walk over to the Columbus River Walk and watch people shooting the rapids and see this cool new development area. I highly recommend this for a quick getaway vacation from Atlanta.
